snippet: Abdul Rashid Dostum, a strongman with an unsavory past, is being excluded from Afghanistan’s inner circle of power, a strategy that carries risks.
abstract: Afghan first vice president and former warlord Abdul Rashid Dostum has been marginalized by administration of Pres Ashraf Ghani since taking office; choice of influential Dostum as running mate was calculated move by Ghani, who has since sought to downplay both Dostum and his controversial past; subsequent frustrated behavior by Dostum, in theory second most powerful man in Afghanistan, has raised concern at home and abroad.
lead_paragraph: Abdul Rashid Dostum, a strongman with an unsavory past, is being excluded from Afghanistan’s inner circle of power, a strategy that carries risks.

headline.main: Afghan First Vice President, an Ex-Warlord, Fumes on the Sidelines
headline.print_headline: Ex-Warlord Bemoans His New Role on Sidelines
